result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.   Remainder of fine to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12/1/2016 or penalty of 9 days Huber for non-payment.
Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
See count 2 for payment plan for Fine and DNA Surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert L Thompson in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses amended information.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 2 and 3.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 2 and 3.  Counts 1 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  COUNT 2  

FINE:  $505.00 Bail to be applied

DNA Surcharge: $200.00 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

*********************

The Court Orders the Following:  COUNT 3  

FINE:  $505.00 

DNA Surcharge: $200.00 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing 12/1/2016. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 9 days in Huber
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert L Thompson in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for jury status hearing.  Defense is not prepared to go to trial and expects this matter to resolve.  Defendant is in treatment.  Attorney Kevin Osborne appeared.  Court will set this matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert L Thompson in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Motion to Suppress Evidence Based on Illegal Stop. State requests the witnesses be excluded from the courtroom. Court grants. Officer Adam Parkhurst from the City of Oconomowoc was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the state. Redirect by the defense. State rests. Jamie M. was sworn and testified on behalf of the defense. Cross examination by the state. Redirect by both parties. Defense rests. Officer Parkhurst previously sworn was recalled on behalf of the state. State presents closing arguments. Defense presents closing arguments. Court finds denied by the Motion. Defense requests a short adjournment to speak with his client for the next scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
